summary: The Compassion for Vulnerable and Struggling Workers Act aims to allow certain former civil service employees, wrongfully terminated between January 20, 2025, and January 1, 2026, to enroll in the Federal Employee Health Benefits Program (FEHBP). Eligibility extends to those removed without cause, those with fully successful performance reviews, those who were pregnant at the time of removal, and those diagnosed with cancer in the preceding five years. The government's and individual's contributions for their health benefits will come from savings generated by the United States DOGE Service.
